comments.body:
I'd like to give my feedback on this.

One issue that may arise of allowing people to change their usernames without cool-down is it grants power to malicious users of it. Hackers on servers or rule-breakers will be hard to catch as their identity is constantly changing. As you mentioned too, keeping track of friends will be difficult as well.

Just in general, preserving the identity of a player will be challenging if said player is able to modify their username at will whenever without cool-down. It'll just be chaotic, is all.

With Microsoft accounts becoming mandatory, it would make since to have a system where two names are available, one for your Xbox account name, and one for your Minecraft in game name. This would also open up the possibility of having two people with the same nickname, but a differentiation using a second name on a new profile system or after their nickname in the tab menu.

Perhaps even a system where uuid's are customizable like your real name, and visible in game under your name.

Mojang could also go the rout of integrating a friend system similar to bedrock, so changing your account name will not cause you to loose your connections to other players.

I feel Minecraft is due an overall overhaul to the multiplayer system, primarily in the field of adding features like friending and faster name changing.
Instead of removing it completely I'd say it would be a better idea to reduce it from 30 to a shorter period of time, a fair amount of time I would think would be 14 days (2 weeks).
Please make it shorter! Its too long!

Indeed. Recently I changed my Java Minecraft username to "ItsAFoxInABox" but literally yesterday I got banned for 2 days for "staff impersonation" because there was a staff member called "vvoxl" aka Fox, although literally, everyone knew ItsAFoxInABox was NOT vvoxl's alt or connected to vvoxl whatsoever, and since I changed it about 13 or so days ago, I have to wait 17 days til I can! I feel it unfair, especially when I feel vvoxl and I was on generally good terms. 

I agree with one of the users below's comments, how since your Xbox Gamertag is different it won't really matter. Of course, I do agree also with the fact that changing usernames constantly would be a hassle, but honestly, most people might just change it because they HAVE to. Shortening the time limit to yes, 2 weeks would be a big relief, and maybe if for security and hassle you could have a subtitle underneath or something that says "previously known as so and so."
They could just change it to 7 days
I would be nice to reduce to 7 days
Just remove hack clients or hacks accept vape v4 and remove the cooldown
Remove hacks or hack clients and if anyone is coming with hacks just Remove the hacks and do not ban them and do not remove vape lite or vape v4 and remove the cooldown please
Please change my Minecraft username from ydhe to Kaizumi I'm not happy
At least we could reduce the cooldown to 15 days.
Agree 300% At least make it shorter, say 10-15 days. 30 days is painfully painful accompanied with even more pain. Pain in the ass. Painful.  Yeah bye
it stupid and long i want slash 48 back

I created My minecraft ac with a reali bad name first I didint now what what ment because I am Europian and We dont have it. So I played 3 days hypixel and I got blocked because It was offensive. And I cant change It for 20 days.
We need this pls minecraft
At least add a undo duration where you can revert back to your original name if you aren't happy with your decision
Please Do This MInecraft!!!!!!!!!!!
I feel that hackers changing their identity constantly is a risk, so i suggest lowering it to something more reasonable like 14 or 15 days.
I agree, its insanely annoying. I want to change my name but I have to wait 5 days. I do not have enough patience

You can sort by oldest to newest, or newest to oldest. :) Additional options are further down the priority list while we work on some of the longer-term bugs.

 

Thanks for the suggestion, though! :)

Sorting by most voted would have the same problem as sorting by oldest, as the oldest comments usually get the most votes. Maybe there should be a default algorithm that mixes random comments with highly voted comments. In more detail, there will be a 50% chance for a specified comment to have high votes and a 50% chance for a specified comment to be randomly selected. That way, people don't ignore other comments while looking for highly voted ones.
RomanTick194173 - please report duplicate posts using the report button. Thanks.
I agree, I don’t want to see feedback from 2018 while it’s 2020 hahaha

it would be nice if we could have depth to the comments.

for example. if i like someones comment but want to add onto it or add a small tweak it would be nice to be able to respond to that comment rather then just making a new one that might not be seen as associated with the comment i originally liked. my thought is if there is a comment system like reddit. where responses are set back to make it easy to see what is a response and what is a new comment of its own.

hello mojang today I come with another invention that is the same is another vehicle that I want to mention is the train will be in minecraft and it is an idea for minecraft and is very curious

train: the train is a minecraft vehicle that can be found in villages because it circulates in villages and mines

Objective: Your objective is to transport cargo like minerals and objects like blocks or any object

mod: the mod runs on two routes and also the train is controlled by mining villagers

route 01: this route goes to the remodeled mines to search for minerals and stone

route 02: this route only looks for only merchandise or blocks or objects to transport in villages

Features: It is based on the model
4-4-0 class of wheels the train wheels are yellow its tank is black and its chassis and the cabin is red the blue windows long chimney and two yellow caps

how to craft: to craft you need two wagons, a fire for the fireplace and four iron blocks

how to handle it: for android or macOS or IOS it is handled with a simulator with an arrow the arrow is used to go at speed it runs up to 100 mph and two buttons the first to illuminate and the second emits sounds of the steam train
for pc it is handled with the fg on the keyboard the j to illuminate and the u for sounds
for consoles to move the cross that has the consoles serves to advance the a to illuminate the x for sounds

well that's all goodbye and thanks.

hi mojang this would be realy helpful of you. I want you to take out the sign in on minecraft i dont know how to sign in and i realy want to play online. that would be all i wish for. just please take out the sign up thing because i cant play mutipllayer.
Also why is someone talking about trains?
You can now sort comments by votes as well.

Appreciate this feedback! 

I suspect the next category to undergo a split will likely be mobs, animals, and non-Humanoids, though - there's an awful lot of overlap in blocks, tools and items.

We'll stick this one under review though for the moment until we figure out how to balance things out.

(Edited today to note: Actually pretty happy with how Mobs, Animals, and Non-Humanoids is working out for the time being, so still interested in any "compelling case" that can be made for blocks, tools, and items.)

What about Decorative blocks (which would contain things like plants and items that are in the game for aesthetics only), Foods  (this would be both blocks like melons, and drops that are being requested which are for consumption, including potions), Tools (these would be items that when held can be used to interact with environment), Functional blocks (which would be for things like new ores, or blocks that can be interacted with for a purpose, like obtaining a drop)

Sure there will be some overlap, but as it is now, no one can browse through the almost 3000 entries.

I know that most of this could be solved if people used the search function, but many of the posts prove, people are not doing that.

Maybe it would be good to have the search more predominant. Try to inspire people to search first, post later.
I think blocks and items can go together, but not tools. Tools should be renamed to "tools, weapons, and armor"
I agree. This category is way to general and so we need a specification.
What about splitting Crops and Plants into a different category from this too.
Biomes and Dimensions need their categories split as well.
Blocks!
Added relevant website to subject line.
I like this idea, it would make the site more valuable to a wider range of people.
That’s a great idea.  EX: Zombies originally came into Minecraft when Archie did an evoker spell wrong and instead made a dead villager come alive.
That would be great! My favorite mob is the Warden (coming soon) but right now in the game is Phantoms. I want origins for them
Good idea

Iron golem is robot?
Guardian is live stone?
Vex is illager soul?

Very good idea.
Excellent idea. I would certainly use this for my trading reforms post.

Currently this isn't much of a problem because we aren't able to write that much. For example with this post you were only 400 characters of the limit. This would be way more useful if we were able to write more than the current 1500 character limit.

Please remember to keep your conversations constructive, on topic and civil in the comments.
Please do not spam the post with +1, yes, agree (or even the opposite forms of these) - this is what the voting mechanic is for, and so those posts will be removed.
The discussion area should be used to talk about implementation, changes, and things like that directly related to the idea!
This a great idea for people new to the site! we need this. maybe there can be other highlights for things like " post feedback here", it could be highlighted in blue maybe?

Well, posted this feedback because few of my ideas got rejected and I didn't know why, so I started looking for something that could tell me what was wrong. Honestly, I wouldn't ever think that it is put in those 4 links. People like when they receive all the rules in one post - Feedback Site messed it up a little dividing the rules into 4 posts. Highlighting the rules will help everyone because even community members who visit this site since months may not know the rules.

I agree that 'Post Feedback' also should be more noticeable, it can be a button.

Honestly, what I would suggest to start is simply to add a "the" that is not underlined before the "previously considered feedback" link on the grey info box thing when you are making a feedback post, since I missed it the first couple of times because on a quick glance I thought it was part of the same article linked as the "creating great feedback" because of how the underline is barely broken by the comma.  Simply adding a word like "the" between them that isn't highlighted should break up the underline and make it more visually apparent that those are two separate links and improve the odds of people seeing it with literally just adding 3 letters.

Maybe they have a forced portion of some extremely paraphrased feedback rules above the player's screen appear when they start creating their first suggestion, until they disable it with a "do not show again" button. I don't think this will get everyone to read the rules, but it's a start.
This is actually a strategy from the devs, just saying. So when you upload a post and got rejected for unknown reason, you can't post it again because it's counted as a spam. I see you devs

I'm new to the site and my first comment on a post actually got deleted without explanation; I almost decided to give up on the site altogether.

It would be useful as well to be able to see the reason your post was revoked in the place of your post here on the site, highlighting the specific rule broken or being informed of your post being merged with another or added as a comment. This would also help train persons to know what to avoid in case they forget or are unsure whether or not they're committing a faux pas.

Also, I haven't posted anything as yet but I know of other feedback sites that let you draft a post, and use what you've written as a search query so you don't duplicate past posts. If you don't find what you're looking for, you can then proceed to publishing.
I posted the exact same thing, it seems this is unanimously a problem.
This would be so useful. Currently I have to go into another text program to get the word count.
This has been added now.

The character count still does not exist when you report a post or comment and add comments that are for reporting the post. When you report a post, the additional comment character limit for post reporting is 180.
A crafting recipe builder would be a useful addition to the site.
Its should also have an icon for a ? So that people can show that they aren't sure for a certain item in the recipe
sounds cool!

this idea is probably one of the most big brain ideas i heard
Also there should be an option to take you to the "see all submitted feedback" page rather than going to the main feedback page to then have to click "see all submitted feedback"
It happens on computers too. I've had to start using the back arrow, but sometimes I still forget and click the readily available button.
literally yes

This is a bit of a nitpick, but I think another useful option would be to search posts, not just titles. Including comments can bring up way too much, and limiting it to titles would bring too little. And a lot of times the original post includes more descriptive words than the title.

would also help a lot to sort the results by newest/votes/comments and like you said category, and maybe add a new option "range of votes" basically you get all suggestions with a number of votes within your range for example 10-15 votes, <100 or >2000.
I think you should be able to filter the search results you get like how you can when you haven't searched

Since this post is under review, I want to link people reading this comment to another interesting post about improving the searching functionality: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076061331-Random-Posts (this isn't my post, it's just a post I like a lot).

Agreed that Search functionality needs big improvements. As-is, it's basically impossible to find anything with the search bar, and the search breaks after a few pages because the lower half of the page (Knowledge Base) runs out of results and won't let you go any further to see more results from the upper half of the page (Community) without editing the search page's URL (the "page=" part).

Features I'd personally like include:

  • The ability to only search through Knowledge Base, Community, or both.
  • The ability to only search through Comments, Titles, Post contents, or a combination of the three.
  • The ability to filter your search results by Category.
  • The ability to sort results by Votes, Comments, Date, and Activity.
  • The ability to filter your search results by Needs Info, Under Review, Announced, Released, etc.
  • A bug fix for the above-mentioned problem where searches break after Knowledge Base runs out of results.

Hope that was a comprehensive list!
Searching for posts is a pain in the neck most days so this is a 500000000 star idea
Yeah because Twitter (also known as X but who calls it that) is pretty much on its deathbed
Didn't even know they had a twitter account. Being on the fediverse (i.e. Mastadon) would mean I could actually see there posts.

So, basically tags on posts. :)

It's not something we see coming soon, due to limitations in our current software that would need to be addressed, but we have asked for post tags, and there is interest from the team that would be doing this.

As such, this does sound like a good discussion could be had for what those secondary categories could be!
Good to know!
This would make things a lot easier to find! I hope Minecraft can get it in sometime.

Something I want is subcategories, so that we can be specific in what are ideas are for, without someone needing to read our post, 

and so that we can search for certain things better.

Since you are planning on adding more biomes to the Nether and the End, you should break up the biome category into sub categories (actually this should be done for most of the categories). When you click on a category, it should lead you to a menu with multiple subcategory options. One option should ALWAYS be all, which will give you all the posts in the category, without needing to think about what you are looking for.

Also, subcategories can be broken up into their own subcategories (or subsubcateglries), and they should also have their own all option.

Sub categories for Biomes and Dimension:

-Dimensions

-Biomes:

  • Overworld:
  1. Ocean
  2. Mountain
  3. Lively
  4. Hot
  5. Cold
  • Overworld Cave:
  1. Hot
  2. Cold
  3. Lively
  • Nether:
  1. Bright
  2. Dark
  • End:
  1. ?
  2. ?
The random idea picker could be able to search for posts with only certain tags. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/24288021806477-Random-Idea-Picker

There should be a red rejected tag for your post or comment if it fails pending approval. Then only the owner of a post or comment has 24 hours to read it before it is removed entirely. If the post was approved already when it was removed, there will be an orange removed tag. Posts with the rejected or removed tag can no longer be voted on or have new comments posted.

There should be a tag that the owner of a post can toggle, which leaves the post in pending approval forever and will neither get accepted nor rejected.

  • Whether the post was edited or not, the tag won’t go away unless toggled by the owner of a post.

Tag name: Approval lock

Tag Background: Teal
Where do you want to see it? Minecraft.net or a Knowledge Base section like the change logs?

The Knowledge Base. I feel like Minecraft.net is more of the place to get get the news first hand with more detail and interviews. Where as the knowledgebase, while it may not have as much detail as minecraft.net , it captures more news. As for logdotzip's mnu, it never really gets all of the news and some bits are left out. Just an idea I had though
Appreciate the clarification! Updated the subject line for clarity.

It isn't really constructive and it doesn't help with listening to the community if they are afraid to edit their posts. I have a post with 370+ votes that i want to edit to include something, but i'm not doing so for the sole fact that i'm afraid it will get deleted. Mojang did that to another player and he never got back the votes his first one originally had when he remade it.

Once I had a great (in my humble opinion) post that got removed.  After reading the rules of writing feedback, I realized it was because I had added some unnecessary pictures.  Because of one edit, my post got removed.

A post I recently edited and attached an image to got taken down for whatever reason. It's really annoying that it keeps happening and that Mojang hasn't given me an email telling me why they did it or anything.

Edit: Turns out, after some trial and error, the post was getting taken down because of the image. I don't understand why since its only purpose was to display the structure I was going for, but that's what was causing it for whatever reason. Still shouldn't even be happening regardless.

relax, there not going to reject editing... right?... ok i hope they said yes but uhhhh yeah

but that hadn't happened and i edited this too so uh, just dont use unnecessary pictures

i mean, i don't even need pics for this reply
and... why is there 38 votes? even though there are 3 comments

They just deleted one of my posts that had 27 votes after I corrected spelling that had been accidentally duplicated! Mojang fix this! I had to edit some of my other posts because of this and now they risk getting deleted too! They don't even send an email, or send it to another pending category where I can correct the problem before it gets deleted.
Do not be afraid as long as the posts are backed up elsewhere.
If you back up your posts, there’s a problem. All votes are not retained after a post is deleted.

I had a post that was rejected almost right away and it was in the middle of editing. It was the Fireflallay and no email or message was sent straight after rejection. It was a well written idea. I was trying to fix flaws in the post but could not do it in time. Maybe posts need at least 5-7 minutes to get accepted or rejected.

Edit: Corrected a mistake: changed ‘I’ to ‘in’ in “could not do it in time”.

It's not a bad idea, just one that will take extra time and some consulting with both our appropriate teams that provide the technical support for website requests like this to see if it is even feasible.

Thanks for your contribution.
I browse the feedback site often. This is a must for me because I spend so much rereading posts when I could be upvoting a newer or unseen idea!

The moderators need to seriously consider this post, it's ridiculous.

I made a post making sure to follow the guidelines, and there were no posts that came up that were about the same topic—which is surprising bc I thought tons of ppl would of already posted the same thing— I even made sure not to user any pictures or links–and my post was about color palettes, so not using pictures was really difficult– and I spent an hour drafting and redrafting it making sure it was well-thought out, but despite all that it was not even approved for others to see. 

It's really discouraging I wish the mods would at least say what was wrong, so so many people expressed the same frustrations about the feedback site, it's infamous for this.

I agree.

And I would like a place on this site where you can see your disapproved posts. It feels so off when the post that you have just been working on simply disappears.

I agree, and this has also happened to me recently! 

And I'm suddenly unable to post feedback...

Which is unfair, considering that I was not informed that they removed my posts...

In addition, it needs to be easier to find feedback related to yours...

I had several posts removed today, because I was not aware of several similar posts (And I checked- or at least, I thought I did... Which is my point; I checked for similar posts, and I couldn't find the ones that were similar...)

You are lucky your post even got approved, what with SEVERAL similar complaint posts out there. But I see you have much more explanation about what exactly annoys you, like the long post removal thing. I 100% agree that the site needs a pending approval revamp. I've posted a well suggested post with 0 posts out there with the same idea, and it's "pending approval"...

Agree.

And it is not only about new posts, it is also about comments.

They say: Dont make a new post, comment to a similar post!

Me: *trying to do so, thinking about a good, constructive comment that sticks to the topic and gives further suggestions*

Mojang: "Well yes, but actually no!"

None of my comments get even approved, and nobody tells me why. And this obviously also happens to others all the time :(

I keep trying and following the posting guidelines. Sometimes I can tell myself why the feedback wasn't approved but sometimes, like today when I posted a comment under the snapshot 5 article, it followed all the guidelines. It wasn't a duplicate comment. But my feedback wasn't approved (or was removed because I saw someone refer to a comment with contents only mine had as far as I'm aware). And I have no clue why. I wish they'd give us a notification, some indicator of what we're doing wrong. It's way too frustrating.

Firstly, some posts can be controversial, especially when it comes to previously considered suggestions or potentially inappropriate content. Secondly, a major overhaul in gameplay is a lot of work for the developers, so naturally, people are discouraged from making posts that have significant effects on gameplay.

Ideally, I think the entire post approval system that holds certain posts automatically detect as 'pending approval' should be gutted, or at least a reason for removal provided. It's frustrating, borderline censorship, and prevents people from finding relevant previously submitted feedback.

Seriously! I posted a feedback on something that i have not seen anyone post about before (Trim enchantments) but somehow it got deleted too. No clue what guideline it broke but not any that are mentioned on the guidelines page.

With all the money Microsoft is making by all those microtransactions from Minecraft Bedrock Edition (since most of the revenue ain't going to the creators), they could totally hire new moderators and speed up the approval times
mojang seem to only listen to big known youtuber and ignore and delete normal people feedback. this is called censorship and can make massive backlash

We do have an announced items column on our top page - depending on how you arrived on the site you may not see it! We thought about adding an under review column on the other side, but the feedback community really wanted a place where random ideas could filter to the top. (Before we all go down that path, please know I know the algorithm can be better. I know.)

Due to current software limitations, we don't have the ability to create an "announce-only" or "under review" category that's read-only.

 

What you can do is use these links:

Announced

Under Review (ignore the name of the url, all you coders out there can clearly see we had to work with some hardcoded stuff when we changed the tags to fit the site)

As always I feel compelled to remind people that the word announced is reserved for things announced during events or through minecraft.net. We don't make announcements of features here, and things stay announced until such time they are either released or the team asks us to change the status to no longer planned. (You can't really unannounce something. :)

Under review is just that. It is not a promise of future features, only that it has been discussed by the team. It is not an announcement or promise of future features. Some things have been under review for quite a while. We do not promise updates (so please don't ask), but when we have them they'll be provided!

That said you can always sort each category to see the ones relevant to that category. Hope that helps.
Great idea!

Hi there,

Please note not every post is moderated before posting (that would be impossible to keep up with for staff - it is technically possible). While our spam filter does it's best to catch spam, it's not absolutely perfect. Combined with the moderation filter designed to help remove the rest of the issues (and also curb the tide of duplicate topics), the site does a better than average job keeping things clutter-free.

We are always looking at ways to empower our real, human members of the community to keep the spam low.

In the meantime, please use the report button and do not engage with spammers. Trust me, no one enjoys spam. Thanks for caring so much about your community feedback site! :)

This already exists, If you go and click this button:

You can then find all posts that have their respective categories, as shown below:

Note: It only goes up to 1200 pages of feedback.
